intro: Erysimum flavescens, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers range in color from yellow to orange, blooming in early spring. Erysimum flavescens is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
